title: Summer is almost over, but it's never too late for a michelada
author: EMILY FABER; Sinclair Broadcast Group
description: NEW YORK CITY (SBG) — When the vivid hues of sunset stretch late into the evening hours and even the darkness that follows offers little respite from the sweltering heat of a summer day, the cocktails deemed most suitable for the season are appropriately refreshing. You've got the mojito, the paloma, and the tequila sunrise, all of which seem destined — the latter by name — to be imbibed under sunny skies. Pina coladas and frosé practically demand a pool or a beach, or perhaps a rooftop.
